abstract: India retracts draft proposal for encryption of social media that would require users to keep texts of their messages for 90 days so that they could be available to police; widely criticized plan came as embarrassment days before Prime Min Narendra Modi planned to visit Silicon Valley in effort to promote India as emerging market for digital technology.
lead_paragraph: A policy requiring that plain-text versions of messages be saved for 90 days for possible police inspection was condemned as draconian and impractical.

headline.main: India Retracts Proposal on Encryption for Social Media Data After Outcry
headline.print_headline: India Retracts a Proposal to Regulate Social Media

snippet: A policy requiring that plain-text versions of messages be saved for 90 days for possible police inspection was condemned as draconian and impractical.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
